name: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU)
description: MoU for business collaboration and partnership discussions
body: MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING
This Memorandum of Understanding ("MoU") is entered into on {{date}} between:
{{party1_name}}, having its office at {{party1_address}} (hereinafter referred to as "Party A")
AND
{{party2_name}}, having its office at {{party2_address}} (hereinafter referred to as "Party B")
Party A and Party B are collectively referred to as the "Parties" and individually as a "Party".
WHEREAS:
A. The Parties desire to explore opportunities for collaboration and mutual cooperation;
B. The Parties wish to record their understanding and intent regarding such collaboration;
C. This MoU is a statement of mutual intent and does not create legally binding obligations unless specifically stated.
NOW THEREFORE, the Parties agree as follows:

1. PURPOSE

The purpose of this MoU is to establish a framework for {{collaboration_purpose}}.

3. TERM

3.1 This MoU shall be effective from {{date}} and shall remain in force for a period of {{duration_months}} months.

3.2 The MoU may be extended by mutual written consent of both Parties.

7. CONFIDENTIALITY

7.1 Both Parties agree to maintain confidentiality of all information disclosed during discussions and collaboration.

7.2 Confidential information shall not be disclosed to third parties without prior written consent.

8. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

8.1 Each Party retains ownership of its pre-existing intellectual property.

8.2 Ownership of any jointly developed intellectual property shall be mutually agreed in writing.

9. NO PARTNERSHIP

This MoU does not create a partnership, joint venture, agency, or employment relationship between the Parties.

10. NON-BINDING NATURE

10.1 This MoU is a statement of mutual understanding and intent.

10.2 Except for Clauses 7 (Confidentiality) and 12 (Governing Law), which are legally binding, this MoU does not create legally enforceable obligations.

10.3 Any definitive agreement shall be executed separately in writing.

11. TERMINATION

11.1 Either Party may terminate this MoU by giving 30 days' written notice.

11.2 Termination shall not affect obligations of confidentiality.

12. GOVERNING LAW

This MoU shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of India.

13. AMENDMENTS

This MoU may be amended only by written agreement signed by both Parties.

14. ENTIRE UNDERSTANDING

This MoU represents the entire understanding between the Parties concerning the subject matter and supersedes all prior discussions.
IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this MoU on the date first written above.

For {{party1_name}}:

Signature: _______________
Name:
Designation:
Date:

For {{party2_name}}:

Signature: _______________
Name:
Designation:
Date:
